About The Facility

Mental Health, Drug & Alcohol Services (MHDAS) provides integrated and recovery oriented mental health, and drugs and alcohol assessment, treatment and support to people of all ages and their families within the Barwon region experiencing, or at risk of experiencing, mental health and drug & alcohol issues.

About The Role

Fixed term, part time 32 hours per fortnight until 9 October 2019.

Barwon Health is seeking a senior clinician with extensive experience in forensic mental health and leadership to deliver the Forensic Clinical Specialist (FCS) position. The FCS will take the lead role in building capacity within the mental health workforce to work with consumers with complex risk, mental health, forensic and problem behaviours presentations and histories. Leadership in organisational quality improvement and service development, and promotion of strong collaborative networks between mental health and justice services are other key responsibilities of the role.

We Are Seeking Either
  • Gr 4 Social Worker, Psychologist, or Occupational Therapist
  • Gr 5 Psychiatric Nurse


About The Culture

We promote positive respectful relationships and strong working partnerships in the workplace and in the community. As a service we are focussed on providing the highest quality patient centred care. Apply today to gain satisfaction from the positive difference that our programs make to members of our community.

Barwon Health Staff Benefits

  • Access to employee wellness facility

At Barwon Health we celebrate and harness diversity, and consider it a competitive advantage. We encourage applications from all diverse backgrounds including individuals that identify as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, GLBTIQ+, and individuals with disability. Our organisation promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of all our consumers including children and appropriate rigorous reference and background checks will be undertaken. Barwon Health is proud to be Totally Smoke Free.

Mobile Return to Work Specialist - Worker's Compensation VIC

Company Name Gallagher Bassett Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

Gallagher Bassett (GB) is Australia and New Zealand's premier third party claims administrator. We manage claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations. We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co, with over 26,000 great people worldwide in over 140 countries.

Through a team geographically dispersed throughout Australia, GB provides a suite of claims management and related services out of CBD offices located in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide and in New Zealand from Auckland, Napier, Wellington, Christchurch, and Dunedin.

We are proud to be one of 124 companies from 19 countries and representing 52 industry categories, named on the Ethisphere Institute’s 2017 World’s Most Ethical Companies list for the sixth consecutive year.

The position

Currently we are seeking multiple Mobile Return to Work Specialists to join our team located in Melbourne’s CBD.

These positions are full time, permanent roles within our Worker’s Compensation VIC team.

The main objective for the Mobile return to Work Specialist role is to provide advice and/or assistance to Worker’s Compensation Victoria claims staff, employers, workers and treating health practitioners to promote cost effective, durable Return to Work outcomes centered on a customer focused workers compensation claims service.

Other responsibilities of the position include but are not limited to:
  • Providing a face-to-face, added level of a service to injured workers and clients, with the objective of driving and improving return to work
  • Utilizing Worker’s Compensation knowledge and skills in injury management in conjunction with exceptional stakeholder management skills to achieve optimal service and return to work outcomes
  • Providing Injury Management assistance/advice to claims teams, and providing coaching and mentoring to Case Managers
  • Providing advice and/or assistance to Worker’s Compensation Victoria claims staff, employers, workers and treating health practitioners to promote cost effective, durable Return to Work outcomes centered on a customer focused workers compensation claims service.
  • Communicating strategically with all stakeholders. This includes upfront expectation setting and education regarding obligations
  • Facilitating stakeholder engagement including relevant workplace parties and treating health practitioners
  • Providing exemplary client service
  • Participating in claims review meetings as required

Job Qualifications

 What we are looking for:

Essential
  • Tertiary qualification in an appropriate discipline and / or demonstrated experience in a similar role is essential
  • Claims Management or Industry experience
  • Thorough practical understanding and experience in effective management of Return to Work
  • Demonstrated understanding of common injuries, treatment options and medical terminology
  • Demonstrated ability to provide excellent customer service to a wide range of clients and stakeholders

Desirable
  • Industry specific qualifications
  • Knowledge of general business and administrative practices
  • Experience with facilitating RTW for workers with a psychological injury

What We Can Offer You
  • Attractive remuneration packaging
  • Motor Vehicle and Car Parking allowance (specific to role)
  • Flexible work hours
  • Staff referral incentive
  • Opportunities for ongoing education and development
  • Service recognition awards
  • Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members
  • Personal touches like weekly fruit bowls and birthday celebrations
  • The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program
To apply

If you think you can make a positive difference to our business we want to hear from you today!

Click on Apply for this Job.

Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this position.
 Agency candidates will not be considered for this role.

910145467:
[

Security Engineer

Company Name Tyro Payments Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 32 minutes ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who We Are

Tyro is Australia’s largest fintech and newest bank. We’re giving the business banking world a good shake up, with smart technology that save Australian businesses time and money.

We’re born different.

We don’t follow the easy path, we blaze our own unique trail.

And we want like-minded people who understand where we’re coming from and where we’re going.

When it comes to banks, lots of them say they’re different.

But Tyro really is different. We don’t do mortgages, personal loans, or investments. We’re all about business.

We may be new, but what we lack in heritage, we make up for with relentless determination and a focus on the future.

Our singular goal is to make life better for business owners with superior products and services that are simple and seamless so our customers, and our people, can keep blazing our own unique trail.

What You'll Be Doing
    • Representing security, you will spend time working in project teams helping to enable the Tyro business by securing our critical assets, including
    • Designing and implementing enterprise class security systems for our banking and corporate environments in the cloud and on premise.
    • Supporting a shift to enable self service for delivery teams to tap into key security systems and controls.
    • Consulting to project teams with technical security questions.
    • Designing and building security controls that are highly efficient through automation.
    • Provide advanced technical support for issues related to the systems you help build.
    • Promote existing, whilst at the same time challenging and driving changes in our security architecture.
    • Be a key contributor in team planning and prioritisation sessions.

What We're Looking For
    • A strong base in information security fundamentals.
    • A strong foundation in securing fast moving environments.
    • The ability to work in a team to implement security systems which allow the business to move at speed.
    • Demonstrates outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence without authority.
    • Understands that not everything is technical and that the processes and people are just as important.
    • Loves learning and sharing their knowledge with the team.
    • Works well in a team but can manage their own tasks and doesn't need others to tell them what needs doing.
    • Leaves their ego at the door.

We'd Also Like You To Have
    • Prior experience improving existing and proposed security architectures.
    • 5+ years experience building in a systems support role with experience with at least 1 year related to cloud implementations.
    • Experience working within or closely with DevOps teams.
    • Experience with infrastructure as code (eg. Terraform).
    • Coding/scripting skills in a high level language (e.g. Python).
    • Understand the use of pipelines for automation purposes.
    • Hands-on AWS experience highly desirable.

Why work for us

We're not just like every other bank. Tyro has always been a tech company at heart, but fostering a diverse and inclusive environment, and a passion for continuous learning has always been one of the most important parts of our company's culture.

Tyros are a highly collaborative mix of people. You will work closely with our awesome teams and individuals in engineering, product management, customer support, sales and other functions within the business. Everyone is committed to delivering great outcomes for our customers, and you will have the chance to change the face of banking for Australia businesses.

Our 400 strong team of Tyros, just like our customers, are the lifeblood of our business. We go to great lengths to ensure a positive and enjoyable employee experience for all. We offer some amazing employee benefits such as a generous training budget, regular training for professional and personal development, 16 weeks paid primary carers leave, 3 weeks paid secondary carers leave, annual team based volunteer day, 17.5% leave loading and not to mention our multiple craft beer kegs (selection of beers carefully selected by our beer connoisseurs), wide selection of wine, variety of snacks and a ping pong table, selection of board and video games and an awesome rooftop area for socialising, all available to be enjoyed.

Privacy and Submitting your Application

By proceeding to submit your application, you acknowledge that you have read and understood Tyro’s Privacy Policy ( www.tyro.com/privacy-policy/ ) and Privacy Statement & Consent for Job Applicants ( www.tyro.com/privacy-statement-job-applicants/ ) and consent to Tyro collecting, using, holding and disclosing your personal information in accordance with these policies.

911674250:
[

Principal Planning Officer

Company Name Department of Planning and Environment Company Location Sydney Central Business District, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title: Principal Planning Officer

Job Grade / Classification: Planning Officer (Professional) Level 3

Employment Type: Full Time, Ongoing

Location: Elizabeth Street, Sydney CBD

Agency overview

The Department of Planning and Environment (the Department) is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.

The Commission’s Main Functions Are To

This role is based with the NSW Independent Planning Commission which is a NSW Government Agency established under the Environmental Planning and Assessment Act 1979 (EP&A Act).
  • Perform the role of consent authority for certain State Significant development proposals;
  • Conduct public hearings into planning related matters where directed by the Minister; and
  • Provide advice to the Minister.
The Commission is comprised of a range of highly experienced and independent experts and is supported by the Commission Secretariat. The Commission Secretariat is a small multidisciplinary team and works closely with the Chair of the Commission, Commission members, various stakeholders and the public.

Legislation prevents the Commission from directly employing staff. Employees of the Commission Secretariat are members of the Public Service engaged though the Department of Planning and Environment and responsible directly to the Chair and the Director Secretariat.

Learn more about what it's like to work at the Department on our LinkedIn page.

About The Role

In your new position of Principal Project Officer, you will assist the Chair and senior Secretariat staff with the provision of high quality, succinct reports articulating revision to legislation, policy and procedures. You will be relied upon to recommend innovative solutions to guide the Commission’s work. There will be times when you have to juggle between competing project outcomes in a high-pressure environment whilst managing stakeholder expectations.

Reporting to the Director, Commission Secretariat and working work closely with a large team of commissioners, and the Executive Director, you will drive the implementation of best practice and innovative processes to meet Government goals for a more robust and efficient state planning system.

This role requires you to travel intra state to conduct site visits, travel will be mostly by road to access remote locations, requiring you to possess a current driver licence.

Essential Requirements
  • Degree in planning, environmental management, engineering or other relevant discipline such as Environmental Science, Project Management or Public Administration.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and working experience with relevant environmental and planning legislation and assessment processes.
To be successful in the role, ideally you will have:
  • Excellent report writing skills. Demonstrated experience drafting and editing complex reports and correspondence.
  • Sound understanding of the challenges and contentious issues regarding environmental and land use planning of metropolitan and regional NSW.
Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:
  • Role description
  • Application Guide
  • Applying for a role in the NSW public Sector

Our Commitment To Diversity And Flexibility

At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW.

We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Good To Know

A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period.

To Apply

In your Cover Letter please provide evidence and examples of how your skills and experience make you the ideal candidate for this role.

The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Applications Close: 11:59pm 28 th Of October 2018

Should you require further information about the role please contact; Anna Summerhayes at (02) 93832128 (or Anna.Summerhayes@ipcn.nsw.gov.au ) if you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Emmen Saeed at Emmen.Saeed@planning.nsw.gov.au

If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.”

Entry level

  • Government Administration

  • Business Development
  • Strategy/Planning

911488337:
[

Senior Communications and Media Advisor

Company Name Film Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Film Victoria is the State Government agency that provides strategic leadership and assistance to the film, television and digital media sectors of Victoria. We invest in projects and people, and promote Victoria as a world-class production destination nationally and internationally.

We work closely with industry and government to position Victoria as a leader in the Australian knowledge and ideas economy through the growth and development of the screen industry.

Film Victoria is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity amongst its staff. We strongly encourage suitably experienced people from all cultural backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders.
  • Bring your passion for film, television and games to this dynamic role
  • Help grow Film Victoria's public profile, and increase exposure for the people and productions we fund
  • Play an important part in a newly formed division

With a passion for finding, sharing and crafting newsworthy stories, bring your expertise in media management, PR and communications to this critical role within the Marketing, Communications and Events Team. Working with highly experienced leaders in a newly-formed team, this is an opportunity to make your mark, raising the profile of Film Victoria and the screen practitioners and productions it invests in, and positioning Melbourne and regional Victoria as a world-leading destination for screen production.

A strategic thinker with a creative mind, you will be skilled in performing ‘hands on tasks', while equally motived by thinking about and contributing to strategic objectives and long-term goals.

Key Responsibilities Of This Role Are
  • Assist the Marketing, Communications and Events Manager to create communications and engagement strategies which align to Film Victoria's strategic priorities, in order to promote the organisation's work to diverse audiences and raise the organisation's profile locally and internationally
  • Research, write and deliver all written communications, including the fortnightly e-news, blog, web content, media releases, speeches and promotional collateral, ensuring all written content is factually correct, on brand and on message, adhering to style guides and a consistent tone of voice
  • Work with staff across the organisation to proactively identify PR opportunities, driving increased awareness of Film Victoria's breadth of work and funded projects amongst industry, government and the general public
  • Proactively identify and mitigate for issues management, responding to issues in a quick and professional manner as they arise
  • Develop and manage relationships with media to increase Film Victoria's industry and public profile
  • Build effective relationships with staff in relevant Ministerial offices, government departments and agencies to build awareness of Film Victoria's work and to identify joint announcement opportunities
  • Assist with content planning, bringing creativity to identifying and delivering online content opportunities across multiple platforms


The Ideal Candidate Will Have
  • Significant experience in similar communications roles, underpinned by tertiary qualifications in communications, journalism or a related discipline
  • Exceptional written communication skills, with the ability to craft stories and messaging which is on brand, relevant and appealing to diverse audiences
  • A track record of bringing creativity to content and story planning and delivery across multiple platforms

Job description

An exciting opportunity for university graduates to join a dynamic and responsive team committed to improving the lives of NSW residents through public policy.


  • Apply your tertiary level qualifications in mathematics, statistics, economics, evaluation, finance or commerce to design and inform public policies that contribute to economic growth and improve NSW as a place to live and work.
  • Clerk Grade 3/4. Package includes base salary ($70,652 - $77,363) plus superannuation and leave loading
  • Temporary role for up to 24 months
  • Role is located in Orange NSW.


If you are passionate about developing your analytical and public policy skills, we want to hear from you.


Working with us


The NSW Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPC) is the lead central agency in the NSW Government. Our mission is to enhance the lives of the people of NSW by driving priorities, brokering outcomes and delivering programs and services.


We support the Premier and Deputy Premier, the Cabinet, Ministers and agencies by coordinating policies and services across government. We lead policy development, provide innovative ideas and support Government plans and projects.


Working with us will give you a broad overview in areas such as public policy formulation, public administration and state administrative matters and an opportunity to be involved in a range of state-wide policies, issues and projects.


For more information go to http://www.dpc.nsw.gov.au/about/about_the_department


About the Role


The Graduate Analyst conducts routine economic and statistical analysis and associated project assistance to support and inform departmental strategies, policies and initiatives.

The units that the Graduate analyst would work in cover a range of activities most of which have a quantitative Economics focus. The work programs of those units ranges from program evaluation and economic appraisal, applied modelling and statistical analysis.



You will be responsible for:


  • Undertake economic research, evaluation and analysis to provide timely and accurate information for various internal clients.
  • Prepare routine briefing materials, under the supervision of a senior team member, for Departmental Executive and Ministerial offices.

  2. Describe a time you have incorporated feedback from a supervisor or manager into a project you were working on.

Job note: This role will be initially offered as a temporary opportunity for up to 24 months.


Help: Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact I work for NSW helpdesk 1800 562 679

Portfolio Performance Analyst

Company Name Queensland Health Company Location 33 Charlotte Street , Brisbane, QLD 4000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 102 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The role:


This role will prepare monthly portfolio performance reports for the peak ICT governing committee and analyse, model and forecast investment and performance patterns/ trends and creating capability to model outcomes of ‘what-if' scenarios for the eHealth portfolio. The role will also be required to support the development of dashboards, reports and analytical representations of the eHealth portfolio using a variety of analysis tools (Qlik Sense and advantage) using large, complex datasets from project, HR and financial information systems. This includes continual improvement and the production of real-time, periodic and ad-hoc performance dashboards.


Further key responsibilities will include:


  • Data quality review, extraction and exploration using quantitative, statistical and visualisation techniques and tools to identify opportunities to drive improved performance.
  • Perform objective and systematic quantitative research and analysis on both structured and non-structured datasets.
  • Database administration (including but not limited to) database design; data modelling; controlling access and security permissions and privileges; developing and maintaining database documentation including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata); ensuring storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly; ensuring database integrity and security.


Are you right for this role?


Queensland Health utilises the Queensland Government ICT Skills Framework which, in addition to the National Health Service (NHS) Leadership Qualities Framework, references capabilities from the Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA), under licence from the SFIA foundation. Further information on the SFIA can be accessed via the Queensland Government Chief Information Office and NHS at NHS Leadership Qualities Framework.


The essential requirements for this role are:


Skills


  • Extensive experience and knowledge developing reporting dashboards and analytical tools in a range of tools (Qlik Sense an advantage) that meet stakeholder requirements and are intuitive, responsive, professionally presented using data from complex project, financial and disparate information systems.
  • Proven high level knowledge and expertise with RDBMS systems such as Microsoft SQL and/or Oracle DB, used for the extraction, manipulation of data and creation of ad-hoc reports.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify opportunities to achieve improvements in performance management and analytics to support more informed business decision making.
  • Highly developed research, analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills including the proven capacity to initiate appropriate strategic and operational responses to key issues affecting the performance of the portfolio.


Knowledge


  • Relational database programming (SQL), big data analytics, performance management (KPIs, balanced scorecards) and portfolio, program and project management


Qualifications


  • Extensive experience developing reporting dashboards and analytical tools in Qlik Sense is preferred.
  • While not mandatory, a relevant qualification would be well regarded.

Being at the forefront of contact for the business, you are responsible for providing excellent customer service, guidance and information to meet customer needs.     RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. For over 130 years, its mission has been to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for its 85,000 students, getting them ready for life and work.

    RMIT is currently undergoing a sector leading transformation internally and is seeking a high calibre and experienced professional to drive this program.

    Job Description

    RMIT is embarking on a replacement of its core ERP platform across HR, Payroll, Finance, and Procurement. This program will be entail a significant, multi-year change across all its campuses, faculties and businesses. This role is the Program Director across both business and technology. This role is crucial to the success of the program and will require significant stakeholder engagement, drive and ERP/SaaS experience.

    Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Program Director is directly accountable for ensuring program scope definition, planning and scheduling, change experience, financial reporting, issues and risk management, go to market approach and the overall quality of the outcomes delivered for the program. The successful candidate will also take a lead role in managing, defining and driving third party vendors to assist RMIT in the project solution and outcomes.

    This role will have key oversight of both the ERP implementation working with an SI partner and ERP Platform vendor reporting updates to the Vice Chancellor and governing bodies.

    This role will also coordinate the delivery of this program with the Enterprise Project Management Office and Information Technology Services, ensuring all related and unrelated projects are identified, sequenced with the change impact understood.

    The Successful Applicant

    For this crucial role, RMIT require the applicant to clearly demonstrate both Project and Program Management, with experience across large scale, enterprise level change programs.

    You Will Be Required To Possess The Following
    • Demonstrable track record of ERP platform replacements of similar scale, preferably with experience in Workday implementations.
    • You will possess in depth knowledge of two key program areas, ERP implementations and SaaS change programmes. Again, there is also a strong preference for experience in Workday implementation.
    • Demonstrated ability to deliver large operating model changes within complex environments with a variety of stakeholders, preferably within the Higher Education industry.
    • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills and the ability to lead a diverse team across a variety of skill groups, while also holding extensive history in managing internal stakeholders and driving change to a common goal.
    What's On Offer

    This role will form the key strategy and shape of the future workings of one of Melbourne and Australia's leading institutions, along with implementing a significant program with the Workday platform - a first in Higher Education.

    The successful individual will attract an executive level salary and package, alongside securing a unique opportunity in a sector going through unprecedented change.

    Contact: Joss Godbold

Job description

  • Full Time Position Available
  • Kensington location at Seeing Eye Dogs National Headquarters
  • Leading Not For Profit Organisation
  • Flexible Working Arrangements & Generous Salary Packaging Benefits

Vision Australia Seeing Eye Dogs is seeking an accomplished professional with a strong administrative and customer service background, and a passion for people and dogs, to fill an exciting new role supporting carers of Seeing Eye Dog puppies and dogs in all stages of the program.

Responsibilities

As the Carer Coordinator at Seeing Eye Dogs you will:
  • Develop the effective and efficient administration of the carer program, including publishing procedures and ensuring continuous improvement of systems
  • Manage an accurate and detailed database of over 250 volunteer carers
  • Maintain up to date volunteer records in accordance with professional standards and Vision Australia Policy and Procedures and all relevant legislation
  • Build relationships with carers through providing person centred support that promotes the success of each individual carer and pup/dog
  • Deliver all operational carer program requirements including customer service, stock management, carer training, feedback and compliance
  • Coordinate movement of dogs/pups between carers, kennel facility and dog training program
  • Increase number of dogs in care, reducing number of pups/dogs boarding in the kennel facility
  • Increase carer retention and rate of repeat carers
  • Collaborate with staff in all departments of Seeing Eye Dogs to ensure that dogs' needs are met through the carer program
  • Undertake continuous professional development, including keeping up to date with all policy and procedures, and maintaining skills and knowledge


Requirements

To be successful in this role you will have:
  • Significant experience and success in a similar role
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Proven ability to develop, implement and maintain effective programs
  • Ability to provide feedback and undertake critical conversations with stakeholders

Applications should consist of a full resume and a cover letter. Candidates should address the essential job competencies as outlined the position description and should also consider and be able to demonstrate Vision Australia’s organisational values which are central to the organisation’s culture. Applications should be uploaded as a word file. Please note pdf documents are not accepted for accessibility reasons.

As part of Vision Australia’s commitment to being an inclusive employer and embedding a culture where staff, volunteers and clients can be themselves and feel safe, and to protecting the best interests and safety of children and vulnerable people, successful applicants will be subject to a number of pre-employment checks including criminal history and working with children.

For more information about working at Vision Australia go to www.visionaustralia.org/careers

We encourage applications from candidates who are blind or have low vision.
